info.description: This schema documents the endpoints available to the Vault Management API, accessible from the Bitwarden CLI using the `bw serve` command ([learn more](https://bitwarden.com/help/cli/)). If you're looking for the **Organization Management** API, refer instead to [this document](https://bitwarden.com/help/api/).
info.title: Vault Management API

post.description: Lock your vault. This action will destroy the session key required to authorize requests to most endpoints.

200.description: Success returns confirmation that your vault is locked.

post.description: Unlock your vault. This action will create the session key required to authorize requests to most endpoints.

requestBody.description: The request body must contain an object containing your master password.

schema.title: UnlockPostRequestSchema
schema.description: Request schema for unlocking the vault with master password

200.description: Success will return confirmation that your vault is unlocked and a session key. You **do not** need to do anything with the session key to proceed.

data.title: Your vault is now unlocked!
data.message: To unlock your vault, set your session key to the `BW_SESSION` environment variable. ex:$ export BW_SESSION=\"vdXQ7mRYtcFXueH/Ml+ZgvK//V+0cTJpuAVddMwttNEvVHU6d6xaaRdYokv/9Jqw1uofMq82/B3y/MpV2Yh3Qg==\" or > $env:BW_SESSION=\"vdXQ7mRYtcFXueH/Ml+ZgvK//V+0cTJpuAVddMwttNEvVHU6d6xaaRdYokv/9Jqw1uofMq82/B3y/MpV2Yh3Qg==\". You can also pass the session key to any command with the `--session` option. ex:$ bw list items --session vdXQ7mRYtcFXueH/Ml+ZgvK//V+0cTJpuAVddMwttNEvVHU6d6xaaRdYokv/9Jqw1uofMq82/B3y/MpV2Yh3Qg=="

post.summary: Add a new item to your vault.
post.description: Add a new login, card, secure note, or identity to your vault.

requestBody.description: The request body must contain an object representing the item to add to your Vault. Indicate [item type](https://bitwarden.com/help/cli/#item-types) with `"type":` and only provide data in the appropriate type's object (e.g. `"login":{}` or `"identity":{}`). See the **Examples** for help.

200.description: Success returns an object representing the created item in the `"data":{}` property.

put.summary: Edit an item in your Vault.
put.description: Edit an existing login, card, secure note, or identity in your Vault by specifying a unique object identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path and the new object contents in the request body.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item to edit.

requestBody.description:
The request body must contain an object representing the edits to make to the item.

**Include the full object in the request body**, not just the properties to edit, as the new object will replace the pre-existing object.

200.description: Success returns an object representing the edited item in the `"data":{}` property.

get.summary: Retrieve an item from your vault.
get.description: Retrieve an existing item from your vault by specifying a unique object identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item to retrieve.

200.description: Success returns an object representing the retrieved item in the `"data":{}` property.

delete.summary: Delete an item from your vault.
delete.description: Delete an existing item from your vault by specifying the unique object identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item to delete.

200.description: Success returns confirmation that the item was sent to the trash.

post.description: Restore an item that was sent to the trash by specifying the unique object identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item to restore.

200.description: Success returns confirmation that the item was restored.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of items in your vault.
get.description:
Retrieve a list of existing items in your vault. By default, this will return a list of all existing items in your vault, however you can specify filters or search terms as query parameters to narrow list results.

Using multiple filters will perform a logical `OR` operation. Using filters **and** search terms will perform a logical `AND` operation.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: List all items with this unique Organization identifier.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: List all items with this unique collection identifier.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: List all items with this unique folder identifier.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: List all items with this URL/URI value.

parameters.name: trash
parameters.description: List all items in the trash. This query parameter is not a true boolean, in that `?trash`, `?trash=true`, and `?trash=false` will all be interpretted as a request to list items in the trash.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: List all items that contain this search term in its name, username, or URI.

200.description: Success returns an array (in `"data":[]`) of matching vault items as objects. If no items are found, an empty array is returned.

post.summary: Attach a file to an existing vault item.
post.description: Attach a file to an existing vault item by specifying a the vault item's identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) as a query parameter and the file in the request body.

parameters.name: itemid
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item to attach a file to.

requestBody.description: The request body must contain the file to attach as form-data.

200.description: Success returns the item object with new objects in an `"attachments":[]` array.

get.summary: Retrieve an attachment.
get.description:
Retreive an attachment by specifying the attachment id (e.g. `o4lrz575u84koanvu9f5gqv9a9ab92gf`) in the path and item id (e.g. `ba624b21-1c8a-43b3-a713-ae0000eabdec`) as a query parameter.

If you're retrieving any file type other than plaintext, we recommend posting the request through a browser window for immediate download.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the attachment.

parameters.name: itemid
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item the file is attached to.

200.description: Success returns the attached file.

delete.description: Delete an attachment by specifying the attachment id (e.g. `o4lrz575u84koanvu9f5gqv9a9ab92gf`) in the path and item id (e.g. `ba624b21-1c8a-43b3-a713-ae0000eabdec`) as a query parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the attachment.

parameters.name: itemid
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item the file is attached to.

200.description: Success returns confirmation that the attachment was deleted.

get.summary: Retrieve the username of a login item.
get.description: Retrieve the username of a login item by specifying the item's unique object identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item.

200.description: Success returns an object containing username of the item.

get.summary: Retrieve the password of a login item.
get.description: Retrieve the password of a login item by specifying the item's unique object identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item.

200.description: Success returns an object containing password of the item.

get.summary: Retrieve the URI of a login item.
get.description: Retrieve the URI of a login item by specifying the item's unique object identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item.

200.description: Success returns an object containing the first URI for the item.

get.summary: Retrieve the TOTP code of a login item.
get.description: Retrieve the TOTP code of a login item by specifying the item's unique object identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item.

200.description: Success returns an object containing the current TOTP code for the item.

get.summary: Retrieve the notes of an item.
get.description: Retrieve the notes of an item by specifying the item's unique object identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item.

200.description: Success returns an object containing the notes for the item.

get.summary: Retrieve the number of times a password has been exposed for a login item.
get.description: Retrieve the number of times a password has been exposed for a login item by specifying the item's unique object identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item.

200.description: Success returns an object containing the number of times the item's password has been exposed.

post.summary: Add a folder to your vault.
post.description: Add a folder to your vault.

requestBody.description: The request body must contain an object representing the name for the folder to add.

200.description: Success returns an object containing a generated folder `"id":` and its `"name":`.

put.summary: Edit a folder in your vault.
put.description: Edit an existing folder in your vault by specifying the unique folder identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path and the new folder `"name":` in the request body.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item to edit.

200.description: Success returns an object containing the folder's pre-existing `"id":` and its new `"name":`.

get.summary: Retrieve a folder from your vault.
get.description: Retrieve an existing folder from your vault by specifying the unique folder identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item to retrieve.

200.description: Success returns an object containing the folder's `"id":` and `"name":`.

delete.summary: Delete a folder from your vault.
delete.description:
Delete an existing folder from your vault by specifying the unique folder identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path.

Deleting a folder **will not** delete the items in it.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item to retrieve.

200.description: Success returns confirmation that the folder was deleted.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of folders in your vault.
get.description: Retrieve a list of folders in your vault. By default, this will return a list of all folders, however you can specify search terms as query parameters to narrow list results.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: List all folders that contain this search term.

200.description: Success returns an array (in `"data":[]`) of matching folders as objects. If no folders are found, an empty array is returned.

post.description:
Create a Send.

**Only Text Sends are supported.**

requestBody.description: The request body must contain an object representing the Send to create. Use `"type":0` to indicate text and provide the `"text":{}` object.

200.description: Success returns an object representing the created Send in the `"data":{}` property.

put.description:
Edit an existing Send by specifying the unique object identifier (e.g. `e813e187-70e3-4feb-950a-ae52010c4b56`) in the path and the new object contents in the request body.

**Only Text Sends are supported.**

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Send to edit.

requestBody.description:
The request body must contain an object representing the edits to make to the Send.

**Include the full object in the request body**, not just the properties to edit, as the new object will replace the pre-existing Send object.

200.description: Success returns an object representing the edited Send in the `"data":{}` property.

get.summary: Retrieve a Send.
get.description:
Retrieve a Send by specifying the unique object identifier (e.g. `e813e187-70e3-4feb-950a-ae52010c4b56`) in the path.

**Only Text Sends are supported.**

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Send to retrieve.

200.description: Success returns an object representing the retrieved Send in the `"data":{}` property.

delete.description:
Delete an existing Send by specifying the unique object identifier (e.g. `e813e187-70e3-4feb-950a-ae52010c4b56`) in the path.

**Only Text Sends are supported.**

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Send to delete.

200.description: Success returns confirmation that the Send was deleted.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of Sends.
get.description:
Retrieve a list of Sends. By default, this will return a list of all Send objects, however you can specify search terms as query parameters to narrow list results.

**Only Text Sends are supported.**

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: List all Sends that contain this search term.

200.description: Success returns an array (in `"data":[]`) of matching Sends as objects. If no Sends are found, an empty array is returned.

post.summary: Remove the password from a Send.
post.description:
Remove the password from a Send.

**Only Text Sends are supported.**

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Send.

200.description: Success returns an object representing the Send with `"passwordSet":"false"` inside the object.

post.summary: Move an item to a Collection.
post.description: Move an item to a Collection by specifying an `itemid` and `organizationId` in the path, and specifying one or more Collection identifiers in the request body.

parameters.name: itemid
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item to move.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Organization to move the item to.

requestBody.description: The request body must contain an array of one or more Collection identifiers.

200.description: Success returns an object representing the moved item with the specified Collections added to `"collectionIdss":[]`.

post.summary: Create a Collection for a specified Organization.
post.description: Create a collection for a specified Organization by specifying a unique Organization identifier as a query parameter and Collection information in the request body, including its `"name":` and an array of `"groups":` to add it to.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Organization.

requestBody.description: The request body must contain an object representing the Collection to add. Specifying `"groups":` is optional.

200.description: Success returns an object representing the created Collection.

put.summary: Edit a Collection in a specified Organization.
put.description: Edit an existing Collection in a specified Organization by specifying the unique collection identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path, an Organization identifier as a query parameter, and Collection information in the request body.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Collection.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Organization.

requestBody.description: The request body must contain an object representing the Collection to edit. Specifying `"groups":` is optional.

200.description: Success returns an object representing the edited Collection.

get.summary: Retrieve a Collection from a specified Organization.
get.description: Retrieve an existing collection from a specified Organization by specifying the unique Collection identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path and an Organization identifier as a query parameter .

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Collection.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Organization.

200.description: Success returns a JSON object representing the retrieved Collection in the `"data":` property.

delete.summary: Delete a Collection from a specified Organization.
delete.description:
Delete an existing Collection from a specified Organization by specifying the unique Collection identifier (e.g. `3a84be8d-12e7-4223-98cd-ae0000eabdec`) in the path and an Organization identifier as a query parameter.

Deleting a Collection **will not** delete the items in it.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Collection.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Organization.

200.description: Success returns confirmation that the Collection was deleted.

get.summary: List Collections from a specified Organization.
get.description:
List existing Collections from a specified Organization by specifying an Organization idenfitier as a query parameter. Collections you do not have access to will not be listed.

By default, this will return a list of all Collections, however you can specify search terms as additional query parameters to narrow list results.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Organization.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: List only Collections that contain this search term.

200.description: Success returns an array (in `"data":`) of matching Collections as objects. If no Collections are found, an empty array is returned.

get.summary: List Collections from all member Organizations.
get.description:
List Collections from all Organizations of which you are a member. Collections you do not have access to will not be listed.

By default, this will return a list of all Collections, however you can specify search terms as query parameters to narrow list results.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: List only Collections that contain this search term.

200.description: Success returns an array (in `"data":`) of Collections as objects. If no Collections are found, an empty array is returned.

get.summary: List Organizations of which you are a member.
get.description: List Organizations of which you are a member. By default, this will return a list of all Organizations, however you can specify search terms as query parameters to narrow list results.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: List only Organizations that contain this search term.

200.description: Success returns an array (in `"data":`) of Organizations as objects. If no Collections are found, an empty array is returned.

get.summary: List members of a specified Organization.
get.description: List members of a specified Organization by specifying an Organization identifier as a query parameter.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Organization.

200.description: Success returns an array of users that are members of the specified Organization. If no users are found, an empty array is returned.

post.summary: Confirm a member to a specified Organization.
post.description: Confirm a member to a specified Organization by specifying a user identifier (e.g. `6b39c966-c776-4ba9-9489-ae320149af01`) in the path and the Organization identifier (e.g. `b64d6e40-adf2-4f46-b4d2-acd40147548a`) as a query parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the user to confirm.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the Organization.

200.description: Success returns confirmation that the user is confirmed to the Organization.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of pending device approval requests.
get.description: Retrieve a list of pending device approval requests by specifying an `organizationId` in the path.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the Organization.

200.description: Success lists pending device approval requests.

post.summary: Approve all pending device approval requests.
post.description: Approve all pending device approval requests ([learn more](https://bitwarden.com/help/approve-a-trusted-device/)) by specifying an `organizationId` in the path.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the Organization.

200.description: Success.

post.summary: Deny a specific device approval request.
post.description:
Deny a specific device approval request [learn more](https://bitwarden.com/help/approve-a-trusted-device/)) by specifying an `organizationId` and specific `request-id` in the path.

Request identifiers can be retrieved using `GET /device-approval/{organizationId}`.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the Organization.

parameters.name: request-id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the device approval request.

200.description: Success.

post.summary: Deny all pending device approval requests.
post.description: Deny all pending device approval requests ([learn more](https://bitwarden.com/help/approve-a-trusted-device/)) by specifying an `organizationId` in the path.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the Organization.

200.description: Success.
Success returns an object confirming successful sync.

get.summary: Get the status of the Bitwarden CLI.
get.description: Get the current `serverURL`, `lastSync`, `userEmail`, `userID`, and `status` of your Bitwarden CLI client.

200.description: Success returns an object containing status information about your Bitwarden CLI client.

get.summary: Generate a password or passphrase.
get.description: Generate a password or passphrase. By default, `/generate` will generate a 14-character password with uppercase characters, lowercase characters, and numbers.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Number of characters in the **password**.

parameters.name: uppercase
parameters.description: Include uppercase characters in the **password**.

parameters.name: lowercase
parameters.description: Include lowercase characters in the **password**.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: Include numbers in the **password**.

parameters.name: special
parameters.description: Include special characters in the **password**.

parameters.name: passphrase
parameters.description: Generate passphrase (by default, `/generate` will generate a password).

parameters.name: words
parameters.description: Number of words in the **passphrase**.

parameters.name: separator
parameters.description: Separator character in the **passphrase**.

parameters.name: capitalize
parameters.description: Title-case the **passphrase**.

parameters.name: includeNumber
parameters.description: Include numbers in the **passphrase**.

200.description: Success returns an object containing the generated password or passphrase.

get.summary: Retrieve a JSON template for any object.
get.description: Retreive a JSON template for any object, including vault items, sends, folders, and more. Templates can be used to guide you in creation of new objects.

200.description: Success returns an object containing the template for the specified type.

get.summary: Retrieve your fingerprint phrase.
get.description: Retrieve your fingerprint phrase.

200.description: Success returns an object containing your account fingerprint phrase.

post.summary: Approve a specific device approval request.
post.description:
Approve a specific device approval request ([learn more](https://bitwarden.com/help/approve-a-trusted-device/)) by specifying an `organizationId` and specific `request-id` in the path.

Request identifiers can be retrieved using `GET /device-approval/{organizationId}`.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the Organization.

parameters.name: request-id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the device approval request.

200.description: Success.

organizationId.title: OrganizationIdSchema
organizationId.description: Organization ID if item belongs to an organization

collectionIds.title: CollectionIdsSchema
collectionIds.description: Array of collection IDs for organization items

folderId.title: FolderIdSchema
folderId.description: Folder ID for organizing the item

name.title: ItemNameSchema
name.description: Display name of the vault item

notes.title: ItemNotesSchema
notes.description: Free-form notes associated with the item

favorite.title: ItemFavoriteSchema
favorite.description: Whether the item is marked as a favorite

item.template.description: Template schema for vault items with all possible fields
item.template.title: ItemTemplateSchema

uris.description: Array of URIs associated with this login

item.login.description: Login-specific data schema for vault items
item.login.title: ItemLoginSchema

item.secureNote.description: Secure note data schema for vault items
item.secureNote.title: ItemSecureNoteSchema

item.card.description: Credit card data schema for vault items
item.card.title: ItemCardSchema

item.identity.description: Identity data schema for vault items
item.identity.title: ItemIdentitySchema

uris.description: URI collection schema for login items
uris.title: UrisSchema

field.description: Custom field schema for vault items
field.title: FieldSchema

folder.description: Folder schema for organizing vault items
folder.title: FolderSchema

send.template.description: Template schema for Bitwarden Send items
send.template.title: SendTemplateSchema

hidden.description: Whether the text is hidden by default

send.text.description: Text content schema for Bitwarden Send items
send.text.title: SendTextSchema

collection.description: Collection schema for organizing vault items
collection.title: CollectionSchema

template.description: Vault template schema containing server URL, sync info, and user details
template.title: TemplateSchema

data.description: Status response data containing template information
data.title: StatusDataSchema

data.description: Data schema for lock/unlock response containing status message and display options
data.title: LockUnlockDataSchema

lockunlock.success.description: Success response schema for lock/unlock operations
lockunlock.success.title: LockUnlockSuccessSchema

deviceapprovallist.description: Device approval list schema for organization management
deviceapprovallist.title: DeviceApprovalListSchema

deviceapprovalproperties.description: Device approval properties schema for organization management
deviceapprovalproperties.title: DeviceApprovalPropertiesSchema
